summary: SummaryBaBylissPRO Rapido 2000-watt, Italian-made brushless motor dryer creates increased air power, and dries hair up to 50% faster. The lightest high-performance dryer.
details: DetailsFeaturesNano Titanium heat technology40% llighter than other dryersLess than 1 lb6 heat/speed settingsCold Shot button2 snap-in concentrator nozzlesDraw string pouch includedLimited 4 year manufacturer warrantyBenefitsThe MaxLife PRO brushless engine delivers up to 10,000 hours of high speed dryingRemovable noise - reducing filter results in over 50% quieter operationTrue Ion generator leaves hair healthyItem 2302207

reviews.headline: I love this hair dryer, it's light weight and very good qual
reviews.comments: Love it love it

reviews.headline: This is a really good dryer
reviews.comments: When my old T3 dryer broke recently, I began the hunt for a new one. I didn't want anything over the top, just something that worked well and would be dependable for the next 10 or so years (that's how long I had my T3). I tried a couple other brands and ended up returning them for various reasons. Then I found BaByliss and the price point as well as the reputation of the brand seemed right. I love that this dryer has varying speed and heat settings (one of the other dryers I tried had just one HOT heat setting). I have a lot of hair that typically takes a while to dry, and I DO feel that this dryer dries my hair more quickly than anything else I've had in the past. I like that it came with the 2 attachment nozzles (and that it had the option to buy a diffuser attachment separately, which I did). It really is so lightweight and a breeze to use. I'm glad I tried it in store against the Portofino, because this one is significantly quieter and had a much softer hum, which I can only assume is from the brushless motor. I haven't had any issues with the controls being on the handle like others have mentioned, but I could see how to placement might not work for some. The one reason that I did not give this 5 stars is because I don't feel that it makes my hair look totally silky smooth like my T3 did. It has the True Ion generator, so I figured it would give me the same sleek results as my T3, but I am seeing more fly aways popping up with this dryer, and I don't feel that it leaves my hair looking as smooth or hydrated as my T3. But alas, you can't have it all, and this is a really great dryer.

reviews.headline: Super high airflow
reviews.comments: I have a short haircut that I style using my blow dryer and round brush.  I had high hopes for this dryer but the heat seemed too high even at the low set and ditto with the airspeed. Difficult to control as a styling tool.

reviews.headline: LOVE IT
reviews.comments: Amazing for blowouts on my long naturally curly 2b/2c hair. It's the perfect combo of speed and heat to make the process as fast as possible with NO scorch. The cool shot gets actually cool faster than any other dryer I've used. My last dryers were Shark and ghd—not bad or cheap products by any means. But especially for blowouts, this one is the absolute best!

reviews.headline: My favorite ever!!!
reviews.comments: With long thick hair, hair washing/blow drying days are the worst!! But not with this hair dryer!! Maybe 10 minutes and that's with no air drying before hand! Worth every single dollar!!!

reviews.headline: Love it.
reviews.comments: I tried this blow dryer today because my dryer went out and I'm in love. It's super lightweight and easy to hold! Highly recommend.

reviews.headline: Lasted about 18 months
reviews.comments: This dryer started scting up after only a few months. Sometimes it wouldn't start for several seconds, sometimes it smelled weird. After about 18 months it wouldn't turn on at all and it started smoking. This dryer is way too expensive to be less reliable than a Revlon dryer that literally costs one tenth the price.

reviews.headline: Tried and True amazing styling dryer
reviews.comments: This is an amazing dryer because its LIGHT and QUIET! But what makes this even better is it somehow leaves my hair so silky and smooth. My hair has lasted feeling clean and beautiful for 3 days now with a little bit of dry shampoo (which doesn't happen when I don't blow dry). The Rapido also gave me a lot of volume making my hair feel light. The heat on this dryer is amazing!!! It gets really hot for my thick straight hair (perfect for blowouts). The air is not as powerful than the BaByliss Nano dryer but when I need heat, I'll grab this Rapido dryer.

reviews.headline: Would buy again 1000 times!!
reviews.comments: I absolutely love this blow dryer! My husband got it for me for Christmas because my old one was shorting out and it cut my hair drying time almost in half. Went from 20-25 minutes to 10-12 minutes! It also makes my hair feel so soft and smooth after!! Absolutely love this product!!!

reviews.headline: Turns on like a Ferrari engine
reviews.comments: Using this hair dryer is a luxurious experience. To be fair, I upgraded from a small, travel sized Conair. My hair dries quickly with the highest heat setting, then I turn it to the medium heat to style. It is very light for its size. While it was a bit of a splurge, I feel confident that it will last a long time.

reviews.headline: Yes
reviews.comments: No comments

reviews.headline: Excelente
reviews.comments: Me encanto la rapidez del secado, ya que tengo demasiado cabello y amo que el peso sea liviano.

reviews.headline: 3 Minutes Flat!
reviews.comments: I timed myself and I can dry my hair completely in three minutes and it looks amazing afterwards! I was really afraid this would be worth the price but it's 100% worth every penny!

reviews.headline: Smells like burning
reviews.comments:
I tried using it today for the first time. It didn't heat up past medium, and it smelled like burning plastic. Went straight back in the box.

I went back to my rusk w8less, it was less expensive and feels way more solid. I was bummed bc I bought this on sale after using the Volare, but it definitely feels like a cheaper build.

reviews.headline: Hairdryer
reviews.comments: This is the best hairdryer I have ever purchased. It has cut my blow drying time in half!

reviews.headline: Well worth the money
reviews.comments: The stylists at my salon always use this blow dryer so I decided to get one. It is pricey but worth it! I have very thick curly hair and this is powerful enough to straighten it, when most other blow dryers do not work. Highly recommend!

reviews.headline: Damaged my hair
reviews.comments: I think the dryer works well but it damaged my hair. I have very fine hair, so maybe it just doesn't work well for fine hair.

reviews.headline: LOVE this dryer!
reviews.comments: I have had a Baybyliss Portofino hair dryer and loved it for about 8 yrs. The heat on it recently started working intermittently…so I was wanting to replace it (with the same one). Then I seen this one went onsale but was cautious because of reviews saying the blower would quit in a couple weeks. I decided to give it a try anyway because I could return it and grab the Porofino dryer if that happened. Let me tell you, I have had this dryer a few weeks now and it has made a HUGE difference! I have curly poofy humidty horrible head of hair. I have to flat iron anytime I blow dry because of how frizzy/poofy it is. After drying with this dryer…I can go out without flat ironing!!!! Never ever could I have before!!! Its truly amazing!!! Even in this florida heat/humidity my hair stays mostly frizz/poof free!!!! I would not have believed it had I not experienced it for myself!! I am SO impressed and it was SO worth the money!!! Total game changer for me!

reviews.headline: Easily the best dryer I've ever owned
reviews.comments: I have long thick extensions and dreaded wash days because my hair took so long to dry.   I love this rapido dryer!  My hair dries in 1/3 the time.  The hair is much smoother than with my old dryer. Even my daughter loves it

reviews.headline: Lightweight and powerful but broke in 5 months
reviews.comments: I have purchased Babyliss Blow dryers for years. This was my first Rapido. It is much lighter than Pro Titanium. I plugged it in tonight and it started smoking. I reviewed my orders and I purchased the Rapido in October 2022 so it died in less than 5 months. Not happy it died so soon.

media.headline: Great product but buttons stick out into hand
media.caption: Buttons are uncomfortable

media.headline: Caused extra damage to my hair!
media.caption: Picture of my hair that this dryer knotted up ripped out!

faceoff_positive.comments:
I was looking for a new hair dryer and wanted one with a lot of power that had variable settings, a diffuser, and wasn't too loud. I looked at various models and decided to give this a shot. I forget if it has 2000 watts or more than 2000 but either way, most dryers have between 1375 and 1875 watts and wow, does the additional wattage make a difference! My hair dries so much faster now - I can almost hit the snooze bar one more time and still not be late for work!

In addition to the power, it comes not only with one diffuser but three, all different sizes. Two are angled, which is great for when you're using a rounded brush - it goes right along the brush contours. Ok maybe these are technically diffusers - they concentrate the air flow rather than diffuse it - so hopefully you know what I mean when I'm referring to these attachments.

Two speeds, three heat settings with a button for "cold air blast." The high heat setting takes a little time to get to full heat, but when it is at full heat it gets very hot so be careful. I only use that setting when I first start drying my hair to get excess water out and then turn down to medium heat. The intensity of the highest heat setting is my only complaint - but it doesn't stop me from getting what I need from the dryer.

It is also a little bit quieter than my prior (lower wattage) hair dryer and was definitely quieter than other higher power hair dryers I tested at Ulta.

Note that while this hair dryer is pretty expensive, I used a 20% coupon and my points (I save my points toward a splurge) and ended up getting this for under $23. But now that I've used it a few times, while I would not want to pay full price for this, I definitely think it is worth investing in this dryer if you have at least the 20% off coupon.
faceoff_positive.headline: Can't believe I'm writing a dryer review but it's THAT good!

faceoff_negative.comments: I love my babyliss blow dryer, but once your concentrator breaks, it becomes a paper weight! None of the attachments actually fit. Even after emailing Babyliss support, they recommend I go to Sally's with my blow dryer to test out their after market pieces. For this reason I honestly don't know if I'd buy another Babyliss dryer again.
faceoff_negative.headline: Waste of money
